text: Tailwind CSS is an open source CSS library, and their main feature is utility CSS classes that can be mixed and matched. Unlike most other CSS libraries such as Bootstrap, because there are no predefined classes. == Tailwind CSS examples == === Button === To make a button in Tailwind CSS you would use this HTML code: Button This will create a slightly rounded button that is filled in blue with the text "Button" inside it. Result: === Navbar === To make a navbar in Tailwind CSS you would use this HTML code: [ ![Tailwind CSS Logo](data:image/svg+xml;base64,) ](https://v1.tailwindcss.com) Open main menu * Home * About * Services * Pricing * Contact This will create a navbar with the Tailwind CSS logo with the selected page being blue (in this case home) and the rest being white on the navbar. Result: == References == Category:Web design
title: Tailwind CSS
